title: US Senators ask Biden to help ICC with Putin war crimes probe
description: The US has not agreed to provide information to ICC out of concern that the court could one day scrutinise US officials.

title: Man pleads guilty in US probe of Haiti president assassination
description: Rodolphe Jaar faces charges of conspiring to murder or kidnap President Jovenal Moise and providing support to the plot.

title: Spain’s first major wildfire of the year rages in Valencia region
description: More than 500 firefighters battle blaze that has forced 1,500 residents from their homes.

title: Greece welcomes back ancient art amid pressure on British Museum
description: The restitution of Parthenon artefacts from the Vatican increases pressure on the British Museum to return marbles.

title: Why is the US concerned about TikTok?
description: China denies US accusations the popular social media app TikTok is a threat to national security.

title: Dozens missing in latest shipwreck off Tunisia
description: At least 34 refugees missing after boat sinks off Tunisia amid a sharp increase in vessels heading towards Italy.

title: Civilians in Bakhmut ‘pushed to limits of existence’: Red Cross
description: ICRC says about 10,000 Ukrainian civilians are living in 'very dire conditions' in Bakhmut and surrounding settlements.

title: What the new US-Canada border deal means for asylum seekers
description: Rights advocates say expanded border restrictions will push asylum seekers to take riskier journeys to seek protection.

title: Former leader Bolsonaro reportedly returning to Brazil next week
description: The far-right former president has been in the US since December, following his loss in the 2022 presidential election.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu met by protesters on visit to London
description: Hundreds demonstrate against Netanyahu's plans to overhaul Israeli judiciary as he arrives to meet PM Rishi Sunak.

title: Shares in Deutsche Bank drop as global banking worries persist
description: Tumbling stocks dragged down other major banks across Europe, fuelling fears about a banking sector crisis.

title: Lopez Obrador denies US claim cartels control parts of Mexico
description: Mexican president responds to top US diplomat's comments in latest row over violence fuelled by drug gangs.

title: Trump warns of ‘potential death and destruction’ if he is charged
description: Former US president escalates his attacks on prosecutor overseeing investigation into hush money payment to porn star.

title: UN commission ends hearings on rights abuses in Israel, Palestine
description: The commission of inquiry spoke to witnesses, including relatives and colleagues of Al Jazeera's Shireen Abu Akleh.

title: Donald Trump’s Stormy Daniels case: Here’s what you need to know
description: Trump may become the first former US president to face formal charges. Al Jazeera looks at what we know so far.

title: UN decries torture, killing of Ukrainian and Russian POWs
description: The UN Human Rights Office's mission in Ukraine says abuses could amount to war crimes.

title: King Charles’s France visit postponed amid pension protests
description: French president condemns violence that erupted in protests against raising citizens' retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: Hotel Rwanda hero Paul Rusesabagina’s prison sentence commuted
description: Rusesabagina, who was serving a 25-year sentence in Rwanda on 'terrorism' charges, is expected to be freed on Saturday.

title: Ecuador: ‘Modern-day slaves’ seek justice in landmark trial
description: Dozens of current and former workers who harvested fibre for Furukawa Plantaciones say their human rights were violated.

title: ‘We shouldn’t have been there’: US vets consider legacy of Iraq
description: Twenty years after the US invasion of Iraq, veterans question its purpose and struggle with the lingering effects.

title: Kamala Harris to discuss China influence, debt distress in Africa
description: The US has unleashed a charm offensive in Africa under President Biden as it seeks to rival Russia and China.

title: Cuba’s new parliament will face a familiar economic hangover
description: Slammed by sanctions, the pandemic, and high inflation, Havana is making piecemeal reforms which may not be enough.

title: Bangladesh investigative journalist’s brother ‘beaten with rods’
description: Zulkarnain Saer Khan was part of Al Jazeera's investigation that unearthed corruption at the highest level of power.

title: Calls for more pensions protests as hundreds arrested in France
description: Interior minister says hundreds of police injured in the most violent day of protests since they began in January.

title: My mom’s chicken zorbiyan connected me to Yemen, and her memory
description: Akram Said, a chef from New York, shares his mother's recipe for chicken zorbiyan, and the journey to her homeland.

title: Reactions to India’s Rahul Gandhi losing parliament seat
description: Opposition leaders condemn Gandhi's disqualification and accuse PM Narendra Modi's government of 'killing democracy'.

title: Afghanistan and Pakistan set to play first T20I cricket series
description: Neighbours set to square off at match played at Sharjah Cricket Stadium in the United Arab Emirates.

title: Rwanda has to investigate killings of opposition members
description: On this Right to Truth Day, I want justice for all those who lost their lives while fighting for a democratic Rwanda.

title: Russia forces may go to Ukraine’s Kyiv or Lviv cities: Official
description: Medvedev's comments come amid reports of an imminent counteroffensive by Ukrainian forces in the city of Bakhmut.

title: China, Russia face sanctions from US states now. That’s dangerous
description: US states want to join Washington in imposing sanctions on foreign adversaries. That's bad for the world — and the US.

title: Chad says it has nationalised all assets owned by Exxon Mobil
description: The nationalisation of Exxon Mobil's assets in Chad comes after the oil giants divested from them in December 2022.

title: The AU must not allow Tunisia’s Saied to harm African unity
description: Tunisia's populist president is trying to divide us using a white supremacist conspiracy from Europe.

title: Twenty years on, John Bolton is still defending the US’s Iraq War
description: 'It wasn't flawed intelligence' that led to the war, says Bolton, a key proponent of the US invasion.

title: Slovakia delivers first four Soviet-era MiG-29 jets to Ukraine
description: The warplanes were flown from Slovakia to Ukraine by Ukrainian pilots, with help from the Slovak air force.

title: Paul Bremer on Iraq occupation mistakes and accountability
description: Twenty years on from the US-led invasion, Marc Lamont Hill challenges the man tapped to oversee post-Saddam Iraq.

title: DRC’s President Tshisekedi reshuffles cabinet ahead of election
description: Analyst says the overhaul of the 57 member-cabinet just months before the election is a 'deeply political shuffle'.

title: South Carolina OKs bill barring ‘foreign adversary’ land holdings
description: The bill is among numerous measures taken after a suspected Chinese spy balloon floated over the US.

title: China, US in war of words over South China Sea navigation
description: China says US destroyer warned off for second day, US Navy said its ship successfully challenged China maritime claims.

title: Saudi Arabia and Syria ‘in talks to restore ties’
description: Saudi state television reports that the two countries are in talks to resume consular services.

title: Israeli gov’t shows signs of split over PM’s judiciary plans
description: Netanyahu promises to press ahead with judicial changes, despite reports of defence minister's opposition.

title: Activists, everyday Russians and a soldier punished for war talk
description: Almost 500 Russians have been charged under wartime censorship laws. We look at 12 cases.

title: Why India opposition leader Rahul Gandhi may lose parliament seat
description: Formal disqualification order will have to be passed by secretariat of parliament's lower house of which he is a member.

title: Yellen, caught between markets and US Congress, tweaks message
description: Janet Yellen is the face of US govt on the issue and her public comments have sent markets on a roller-coaster ride.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 394
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 394th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: China authorities raid US due diligence firm, detain staff
description: Raid on the Mintz Group office in Beijing comes as China prepares to hold its annual economic forum.

title: US says air strikes hit Syria targets after deadly drone attack
description: Pentagon said air strikes were carried out in retaliation for drone attack on US base that killed one and injured five.

title: Zelenskyy calls on EU to give jets, missiles or expect a long war
description: Ukraine president's comments on need for weapons represents an unusually open display of frustration with EU leaders.

title: Crypto founder Do Kwon indicted in US after Montenegro arrest
description: Co-founder of Singapore-based Terraform Labs faces eight charges, including securities fraud and wire fraud.

title: N Korea tests new underwater nuclear attack ‘drone’: State media
description: Drone cruised underwater for 59 hours, then detonated in an exercise designed to deter S Korea and US forces: KCNA.

title: US accuses top Paraguay politicians of corruption, spurring probe
description: Paraguay's ex-president and current vice president are under investigation for alleged corruption – charges they deny.

title: Canada to roll back asylum access in reported agreement with US
description: Refugee groups condemn anticipated decision to expand Canada's ability to reject asylum seekers at the US border.
